titleStmt.title: A Discourse against profane swearing and cursing wherein I. Those vices are describ'd and reprov'd, II. Both magistrates and private persons are excited to their duty in order to the suppressing 'em by the execution of the late act of Parliament against 'em, III. And the objections commonly rais'd against the present practice of private informations are modestly consider'd.

notesStmt.note: "A discourse concerning profane swearing and cursing. Imprimatur cui Titulus, August 2, 1697. Narcissus Dublin."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
